title.narrative: MONITORING CHILDREN RIGHTS AND EVIDENCEGENERATION

description.narrative: The Government has increased capacity to monitor child rights and to generate disaggregated child-related data and evidence, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, particularly those in situations of disadvantage, benefit from coordinated policies and programmes, have increased access to integrated social services, and have their rights increasingly monitored.

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Improved and integrated social proteciton data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Government has increased capacity to monitor child rights and to generate disaggregated child-related data and evidence

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to strengthen the Government’s capacity in the evidence generation by strengthening data analysis of national surveys and administrative data toward closing important information gaps.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022

title.narrative: of decision makers and program implementers whose capacities to make children data-based decisions are strengthened.(55276)

target.value: 2022:At least three public institutions strengthened to make children data-based decisions.

actual.value: 2021:2 technical documents on longitudinal analysis of early child development.

title.narrative: Existence of a management mechanism for the measurement, monitoring and evaluation of investment on childhood.(55275)

target.value: 2022:At least of 2 reports on public investment in childhood.

title.narrative: of analytical reports based on the measurement of multidimensional child poverty.(55274)

target.value: 2022:At least two reports with updated data.

title.narrative: Existence of an institutionalized rights monitoring system.(55273), Text

baseline.value: There is a limited rights monitoring system.

target.value: 2022:There is an institutionalized rights monitoring system covering all rights.

actual.value: 2021:There is a proposal for an integrated plan of national statistics for monitoring the situation of children (in process)
